author: Staff Reporter
text:
Owners of power loom job working units in and around Tirupur have decided to close down their units indefinitely from January 28 to protest against the cut in job work charges given by the textile units for the production of fabrics.

R. Velusamy, president of Tirupur District Job Working Power loom Weavers Association, told reporters that around 33,000 units in Tirupur and its hinterland would take part in the strike.

“Though the job working charges were raised by 27 per cent in 2014 as per the agreement reached upon between the job working units and the textile units that give the job works for fabrics production, it has not been paid at that slabs except for first few months”, he said.

The agreement was signed for a period of three years.
title: Power loom weavers threaten strike
